bioprojects.title: Cryptosporidium parvum Iowa II genome sequencing project

description.title: Sample from Cryptosporidium parvum Iowa II

assembly_info.comments:
The genome sequence of C. parvum was assembled from 13x coverage by the Abrahamsen lab. The sequencing was carried out at the Advanced Genetics Analysis Center (AGAC) in College of Veterinary Medicine (CVM) of University of Minnesota (UMN). Additional information can be found at: http://cryptogenome.umn.edu/. Long-term curation of the sequence and subsequent annotation updates will be the responsibility of the ApiDB Bioinformatics Resource Center http://ApiDB.org. Annotation can be viewed at http://CryptoDB.org and inquires can be sent to help@cryptodb.org.

The VEuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (www.veupathdb.org) is responsible for the assembled genome sequence and its annotation as of March 2022. Annotation and related data can be viewed and updated at http://veupathdb.org and inquiries can be sent to help@veupathdb.org.

annotation_info.name: Annotation submitted by NCBI RefSeq

description.title: Microbe sample of Cryptosporidium meleagridis str. TU1867
description.comment: Cryptosporidium meleagridis strain TU1867 genomic DNA obtained from BEI Resources NR-2521. Literature search indicated oocysts were isolated from homo sapiens approx. the year 2000 before being passaged in calves. PMID: 21813841; PMID: 12654797; PMID: 12880270; PMID: 27544254; PMID: 10930736

bioprojects.title: This strain has been sequenced for comparative genome analysis

assembly_info.comments:
This version of the project, JCVI-cmg-v1.0, represents roughly 13x hybrid coverage (about 4.5x Sanger and 10x 454) of the genome.
Annotation was added to the scaffolds in October 2008
EuPathDB (http://eupathdb.org/eupathdb/) is responsible for the long term maintenance and curation of this WGS project.

The VEuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (www.veupathdb.org) is responsible for the assembled genome sequence and its annotation as of March 2022. Annotation and related data can be viewed and updated at http://veupathdb.org and inquiries can be sent to help@veupathdb.org.

description.title: Cryptosporidium parvum IOWA-ATCC
description.comment: Cryptosporidium parvum Iowa from ATCC, originated from sporozoites/oocysts originally isolated from the feces of a calf near Ames, Iowa in the mid-1980's and have been passaged continually in calves in Arizona since that time. This sample DNA is currently sold by the ATCC company

bioprojects.title: Cryptosporidium chipmunk genotype I 37763 Genome sequencing and assembly

description.title: Microbe sample from Cryptosporidium sp.
description.comment: Cryptosporidium chipmunk genotype I is an emerging zoonotic pathogen. In order to develop subtyping tools to determine the role of zoonotic transmission in cryptosporidiosis epidemiology, a human isolate of chipmunk genotype I oocysts was sequenced on an Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx (Illumina).

description.title: Microbe sample from Cryptosporidium equi
description.comment: Cryptosporidium equi is one of the major causes of equine cryptosporidiosis, but also infects hedgehogs and humans, with high zoonosis potential. we obtained an isolate of Cryptosporidium equi from a hedgehog and undertook studies to examine its genetic characteristics.
